intro: Chassalia ternifolia, commonly known as the three-leaf chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Chassalia ternifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
